intro: Jasione montana proles cartilaginea, commonly known as the cartilaginous jasione, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
